headline: Ford CEO, Trump Officials Discussed China-US Carmaking Ventures
summary: The rough framework discussed by Ford Chief Executive Officer Jim Farley and Trump cabinet members last month would allow Chinese carmakers to manufacture vehicles in the US through joint ventures with domestic automakers in which the American company holds a controlling stake, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the discussions were private.  The ventures would be structured so that both the Chinese and US partners would share profits and technology in the JV, the people said.

raw.headline: Ford CEO, Trump Officials Discussed China-US Carmaking Ventures
raw.summary: The rough framework discussed by Ford Chief Executive Officer Jim Farley and Trump cabinet members last month would allow Chinese carmakers to manufacture vehicles in the US through joint ventures with domestic automakers in which the American company holds a controlling stake, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the discussions were private.  The ventures would be structured so that both the Chinese and US partners would share profits and technology in the JV, the people said.

headline: Steel and Aluminum Stocks Fall, Automakers Gain After Reports of Tariff Pullback
summary: Shares in U.S. steel and aluminum producers fell after reports that the Trump administration is considering whether to narrow the scope of import taxes on the metals.  Steelmakers Nucor, Steel Dynamics and Cleveland-Cliffs all declined 3% or more Friday, following the reports by the Financial Times and Bloomberg, before clawing back some losses.  Century Aluminum skidded 8.5%.

Century Aluminum skidded 8.5%.
